original_definition: 'common merit order list' means a list of balancing energy bids sorted in order of their bid prices, used for the activation of those bids;

Not Article: In order to allow an exchange of balancing services, the creation of common merit order lists and adequate liquidity in the balancing market, it is necessary to regulate the standardisation of balancing products. This Regulation lists the minimum set of standard characteristics and additional characteristics defining standard products.

In order to allow an exchange ofbalancing services, the creation ofcommon merit order lists and adequate liquidity in thebalancing market, it is necessary to regulate the standardisation of balancing products. This Regulation lists the minimum set of standard characteristics and additional characteristics definingstandard products.
